content.description:
Social psychologists conducted a series of studies on the amount of time it takes for a person to offer help to someone in distress. Two research conditions were created. In one condition, the helper was alone. In the other condition, the helper was in a group with 4 other people. The study results are summarized in the table.

content.question: Based on the study’s findings, in which of the following scenarios is the actor most likely to receive help quickly?

choices.label: A passenger faints on the crowded morning subway
A driver on a busy highway notices a car on the side of the road with the emergency lights flashing
An employee at a company notices that the newly hired employees are being treated disrespectfully
While working together in a small library conference room, a student’s weekly study partner falls to the ground in pain

content.answer: While working together in a small library conference room, a student’s weekly study partner falls to the ground in pain

skill.text: 1.A: Apply psychological perspectives, theories, concepts, and research findings to a scenario.
